article:
'Analytical quality control', commonly shortened to 'AQC' refers to all those
processes and procedures designed to ensure that the results of laboratory
analysis are consistent, comparable, accurate and within specified limits of
precision. [http://www.chemex.co.uk/quality/aqc/program analytical quality
control (AQC) program to ensure the highest level of confidence in reported
data]

AQC processes are of particular importance in Laboratories analysing
environmental samples where the concentration of chemical species present may be
extremely low and close to the detection limit of the analytical method.

In well managed laboratories, AQC processes are built into the routine
operations of the laboratory often by the random introduction of known standards
in to the sample stream or by the use of spiked samples.
